Question.content: Mention the two reagents used for the nitration of benzene

Answer.content: Concentrated nitric acid \(HNO_3\) and concentrated sulfuric acid \(H_2SO4\)

Explanation.content:
The nitration of benzene requires:

  1. Nitric acid (HNO3) as the source of nitro (-NO2) group
  2. Sulfuric acid (H2SO4) as catalyst to generate the nitronium ion (NO2+)

Reaction: C6H6 + HNO3 ‚Üí C6H5NO2 + H2O

Question.content: Mention two derivatives of carboxylic acid

Explanation.content:
Carboxylic acid (-COOH) derivatives include:

  • Esters (RCOOR') - Formed by reaction with alcohols
  • Amides (RCONH2) - Formed by reaction with ammonia/amines

Other derivatives: acid chlorides (COCl), anhydrides (CO-O-CO)

Question.content: Optical isomers that are mirror images of each other are called?

Explanation.content:
Enantiomers are:

  • Non-superimposable mirror images
  • Have identical physical properties except for optical rotation
  • Rotate plane-polarized light equally but in opposite directions

Example: L- and D-alanine

üîÑ Mirror relationship

Question.content: Provide the correct name for 2-methylpropane

Explanation.content:
Common NameIUPAC NameStructure
Isobutane2-methylpropaneCH3-CH(CH3)-CH3

Question.content: Provide the structure of the product formed when chloromethane reacts with benzene in the presence of AlCl<sub>3</sub>

Explanation.content:
This is a Friedel-Crafts alkylation reaction:

  1. AlCl3 polarizes C-Cl bond ‚Üí CH3+ forms
  2. CH3+ attacks benzene ring
  3. Forms toluene + HCl

C6H6 + CH3Cl ‚Üí C6H5CH3 + HCl

Question.content: The bond length between carbon 1 and carbon 2 of but-2-ene is longer than that between carbon 3 and carbon 4. True or False?

Explanation.content:
But-2-ene structure: CH3-CH=CH-CH3

  • All C=C bonds are identical (1.34 √Ö)
  • C-C single bonds (1.54 √Ö) are longer than double bonds
  • This is a symmetrical molecule ‚Üí both double bond carbons are equivalent

Question.content: The hydrohalogenation of propene will not follow Markovnikov's rule if carried out in the presence of ____

Explanation.content:
Normal Markovnikov addition (without peroxides):

CH3CH=CH2 + HBr ‚Üí CH3CH(Br)CH3

H adds to less substituted carbon

Anti-Markovnikov (with peroxides):

CH3CH=CH2 + HBr ‚Üí CH3CH2CH2Br

Br adds to less substituted carbon

Question.content: The name of the product of the reaction between 2-butyne and 2 molecules of hydrogen is?

Explanation.content:
Complete hydrogenation of alkynes:

CH3-C‚â°C-CH3 + 2H2 ‚Üí CH3-CH2-CH2-CH3

Requires:
1. Nickel/Palladium catalyst
2. Excess hydrogen gas

Question.content: The process of determining the molar mass of a compound using boiling point measurements is known as ____

Explanation.content:
Ebullioscopy measures:

  • Boiling point elevation (ŒîTb) when solute is added to solvent
  • Uses the formula: ŒîTb = Kb √ó m √ó i
  • Where Kb = ebullioscopic constant, m = molality

Question.content: The specific group of atoms or bonds responsible for the characteristics and chemical properties of an organic compound is known as _____

Explanation.content:
-OH
Alcohol
C=O
Carbonyl
COOH
Carboxylic acid

Functional groups determine reactivity patterns and physical properties

Question.content: Underline the compound(s) among the following that can exhibit geometrical isomerism: 1-butene, 2-butyne, 2-pentene, 2-methylpentane

Explanation.content:
Geometrical isomerism (cis/trans) requires:

  • A double bond (C=C) ‚úì Present in 1-butene and 2-pentene
  • Different groups on each double bond carbon ‚úì Only 2-pentene meets this

2-pentene examples:

cis: CH3-CH=CH-CH2-CH3 (same side)
trans: CH3...CH3 (opposite sides)

Question.content: What is the empirical formula of 2-heptene?

Explanation.content:
Molecular formula of 2-heptene:

C7H14

Empirical formula (simplest ratio):

CH2

No further simplification possible

Question.content: What is the IUPAC name for the following compound: HCON(CH<sub>3</sub>)<sub>2</sub>?

Explanation.content:
Naming amides:

  1. Identify the carbonyl (C=O) as the main functional group
  2. Two methyl groups attached to nitrogen ‚Üí N,N-dimethyl
  3. Parent chain: 1 carbon ‚Üí methan
  4. Suffix: -amide

Structure: O=CH-N(CH3)2

Question.content: What is the structure of the product(s) of the reaction between hot concentrated potassium tetraoxomanganate (VII) with 2-butene?

Explanation.content:
Oxidative cleavage with hot KMnO4:

CH3-CH=CH-CH3 + [O] ‚Üí 2 CH3-COOH
  • Breaks C=C and forms carboxyl groups at cleavage sites
  • Symmetric alkene ‚Üí identical products
  • Other name for KMnO4: Potassium permanganate

Question.content: What kind of chemical species result from the symmetrical cleavage of covalent bonds?

Explanation.content:
Symmetrical cleavage (Homolytic):

A:B ‚Üí A‚Ä¢ + B‚Ä¢

Produces free radicals with unpaired electrons

Asymmetrical cleavage (Heterolytic):

A:B ‚Üí A+ + B-

Produces ions

Question.content: What property is required in determining the purity of solids?

Explanation.content:
Melting point analysis reveals purity because:

  • Pure compounds have sharp melting ranges (‚â§2¬∞C)
  • Impurities lower and broaden the melting range

Example: Pure benzoic acid melts at 122¬∞C
Impure sample melts at 115-120¬∞C

Question.content: Which of methane, chloromethane, ethane, methanol and aminoethane would have the highest dipole moments?

Explanation.content:
Dipole Moment Analysis

The dipole moment (\(\mu\)) depends on:

  • Electronegativity difference (\(\Delta EN\)) between bonded atoms.
  • Molecular geometry (vector addition of bond dipoles).
Compound Dipole Moment (D) Key Polarity
Methane (\(CH_4\)) 0 Symmetrical (nonpolar)
Chloromethane (\(CH_3Cl\)) 1.87 C-Cl (\(\Delta EN = 0.61\)) dominates
Methanol (\(CH_3OH\)) 1.70 C-O and O-H (\(\Delta EN = 0.89\) and 1.24)
Ethane (\(C_2H_6\)) 0 Symmetrical (nonpolar)
Aminoethane (\(CH_3CH_2NH_2\)) 1.20 N-H (\(\Delta EN = 0.84\))

Why \(CH_3Cl\) wins:

The C-Cl bond has a large dipole moment due to the high electronegativity of chlorine (\(EN_{Cl} = 3.16\) vs. \(EN_{C} = 2.55\)). Unlike methanol, where the C-O and O-H dipoles partially oppose each other, \(CH_3Cl\)'s asymmetry ensures the C-Cl dipole isn't cancelled.

Question.content: What is another name for the Lassaigne method for determining the presence of Sulphur, nitrogen and halogen in organic compounds?

Explanation.content:
The Lassaigne's test involves:

  1. Fusing organic compound with sodium metal
  2. Converting elements to water-soluble ions:
    • Nitrogen ‚Üí NaCN
    • Sulfur ‚Üí Na2S
    • Halogens ‚Üí NaX

This is a qualitative test for elements in organic compounds

Question.content: The actual number of each kind of atom in a molecule of an organic compound is?

Explanation.content:
Formula types:

  • Molecular: Actual atom count (e.g., C6H12O6)
  • Empirical: Simplest ratio (e.g., CH2O)

Example: Glucose

Molecular: C6H12O6
Empirical: CH2O

Question.content: All organic compounds are carbon containing and all carbon containing compounds are organic compounds. True or False?

Explanation.content:
Exceptions to organic compounds:

  • Carbonates (e.g., CaCO3)
  • Cyanides (e.g., NaCN)
  • Allotropes of carbon (graphite, diamond)
  • Oxides (CO2, CO)

These contain carbon but are considered inorganic

Question.content: Arrange the following compounds in increasing order of boiling point: butane, 2-methyl propane, cyclobutane

Explanation.content:
Boiling point factors:

Compound BP (¬∞C) Reason
2-methyl propane -11.7 Branched ‚Üí weak London forces
butane -0.5 Linear ‚Üí stronger London forces
cyclobutane 12.5 Ring strain ‚Üí more rigid structure

Question.content: Arrange the following functional groups in decreasing order of priority: ketone, alcohol, thiol, aldehyde

Explanation.content:
IUPAC priority rules (higher oxidation state = higher priority):

  1. Aldehyde (-CHO) - Highest oxidation
  2. Ketone (-CO-)
  3. Alcohol (-OH)
  4. Thiol (-SH) - Lowest priority

Mnemonic: A King Orders Special Tea

Question.content: Calculate the index of hydrogen deficiency of \( C_{11}H_{15}NO \)

Explanation.content:
IHD formula for CcHhNnXx:

\[ IHD = \frac{(2c + 2 - h + n)}{2} \]

For C11H15NO:

\[ \frac{(2√ó11 + 2 - 15 + 1)}{2} = \frac{10}{2} = 5 \]

Then add 1 for the N=O bond ‚Üí Total IHD = 6

Question.content: Circle the specie or species that is/are nucleophiles:

Explanation.content:
Nucleophiles (electron donors):

NH3 - Lone pair on N

Electrophiles (electron acceptors):

BF3, AlCl3, Br2, CH3+

NH3 is the only Lewis base in the list

Question.content: Draw the structure of 3-ethyl-2-methylhex-1-ene

Explanation.content:
Structure breakdown:

  1. Hex-1-ene: 6-carbon chain with C=C at position 1
  2. 2-methyl: CH3 on carbon 2
  3. 3-ethyl: C2H5 on carbon 3

CH2=C-CH-CH2-CH2-CH3
    |   |
  CH3 C2H5

Question.content: Draw the structure of bicyclo[3.1.0]heptane

Answer.content: A fused three-ring system with 5 carbons in the main bridge and a cyclopropane ring

Explanation.content:
Bicyclo[n.m.p] naming:

  • [3.1.0] indicates:
    • 3 carbons between bridgeheads on longest path
    • 1 carbon on middle bridge
    • 0 carbons on shortest bridge (direct bond)

Structure:

  CH‚ÇÇ-CH‚ÇÇ
 /      \
CH‚ÇÇ      CH-CH‚ÇÇ
 \     /
  CH‚ÇÇ

Question.content: Draw the structure of the functional group isomer of ethanol

Explanation.content:
Functional group isomers have:

  • Same molecular formula (C2H6O)
  • Different functional groups

Ethanol: CH3-CH2-OH (alcohol)

Isomer: CH3-O-CH3 (ether)

Question.content: Give the structure of 1,3-butadiyne

Explanation.content:
Nomenclature breakdown:

  • Buta-: 4-carbon chain
  • di-: Two triple bonds
  • -yne: Triple bond functional group
  • 1,3-: Positions of triple bonds

Structure:

HC‚â°C-C‚â°CH

Linear molecule with sp hybridization

Question.content: Give the structure of propanoic pentanoic anhydride

Explanation.content:
Mixed anhydride formation:

  1. Propanoic acid: CH3CH2COOH
  2. Pentanoic acid: CH3(CH2)3COOH
  3. Anhydride linkage: -CO-O-CO-

Structure:

CH3-CH2-C=O
        |
     O
        |
CH3-(CH2)3-C=O

Question.content: Give the structure of the product of dehydrohalogenation of 2-bromopropane

Explanation.content:
Elimination reaction (Zaitsev's rule):

CH3-CH(Br)-CH3 + KOH(alc) ‚Üí CH3-CH=CH2 + KBr + H2O

  • Removal of H and Br from adjacent carbons
  • Forms the more substituted alkene (propene)
  • Requires alcoholic KOH and heat

Question.content: If a component on a TLC plate travelled 2.5cm and the solvent travelled 3.9cm, calculate the R<sub>f</sub> value

Explanation.content:
Retardation factor formula:

Rf = Distance traveled by spot / Distance traveled by solvent

Calculation:

2.5 cm √∑ 3.9 cm = 0.641
Rounded to 2 decimal places: 0.64

Question.content: In terms of hybridization, what is the percentage of p-character in carbon number one of hex-1-ene?

Explanation.content:
Hybridization analysis:

  • Carbon 1 in hex-1-ene (CH2=CH-) is sp2 hybridized
  • sp2 = 1 part s + 2 parts p
  • p-character % = (2/3) √ó 100 = 66.67%

sp2 = 33% s-character + 67% p-character

Question.content: In what spectroscopic technique are the molecules of the compound bombarded by high energy electrons?

Explanation.content:
Mass spectrometry process:

  1. 70eV electrons bombard sample
  2. Molecules lose electrons ‚Üí form M+‚Ä¢ ions
  3. Ions are separated by mass-to-charge ratio (m/z)

Produces a mass spectrum showing molecular ion peak and fragment peaks

Question.content: Mention any two spectroscopic methods of identification you have studied

Answer.content: Infrared Spectroscopy (IR) and Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR)

Explanation.content:
IR Spectroscopy:

  • Measures bond vibrations
  • Identifies functional groups
  • Range: 4000-400 cm-1

NMR Spectroscopy:

  • Measures nuclear spin transitions
  • Reveals carbon/hydrogen framework
  • ¬πH NMR and ¬π¬≥C NMR variants

Question.content: Draw the structures of the main products ozonolysis of 2-methyl-2-butene and subsequent treatment with Zn/H‚Å∫

Explanation.content:
Ozonolysis mechanism:

  1. O3 adds to C=C forming ozonide
  2. Zn/H+ cleaves ozonide to carbonyls

(CH3)2C=CHCH3 ‚Üí (CH3)2C=O + CH3CHO

2-methyl-2-butene ‚Üí acetone + acetaldehyde

Note: The double bond is completely cleaved
